CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1953, pg. 2 reads: "Winners Of Trip - Errol (Brownie) Davis, assistant district manager of the North Carolina Mutual's Pittsburgh office, and Mrs. Ina M. Philan, agent, who combines the selling of both ordinary and industrial insurance policies, will go to Durham, N.M., to attend the first G. W. Cox Sales Convention of the company. Mr. Davis was one of the three winners in firm's "Northern Frontier" which comprises offices in Pittsburgh, Philadelphia, East Baltimore, West Baltimore and Washington, D.C.  He was in competition with all the assistant managers in the "Northern Frontier" and won his trip on the basis of the highest staff average in sales.  Mrs. Philan had the highest sales production record in Pittsburgh. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Errol (Brownie) Davis, wearing moustache, eyeglasses, double breasted suit jacket, and diagonally striped necktie, posed in front of light colored background, in Harris Studio
